long_desc: The appearance of airports and ports that are large and allow for their own deliniation
notes: assuming paved so doesn't generate any sediment (hence p = 0), but doesn't hang onto anything either (hence c = 1)

long_desc: All agricultural activities on dry land such as moor, mixed gardens and fields.
All kinds of dryland farming are criss-crossed with shrubs, thickets and former logging forests. Often appears in shifting farming areas, and rotation of karst land planting.
All plantation forest areas, both planted and unplanted (still in the form of open land). Location identification can be obtained with the Forest Plantation Distribution Map

Areas of former swamp/mangrove forests that have regrown or areas with sparse (natural) tree coverage or areas with a predominance of low vegetation (natural). This area usually does not show any more logging traces / spots
notes: since mangrove Kc is 10% higher than forest kc, making marshland Kc 10% higher than herbaceous kc

long_desc: Open land used for open-pit mining activities (e.g.: coal, tin, copper etc.), as well as closed mining land that can be identified from imagery based on the association of the appearance of the object. Small-scale or unidentified covered mining lands are classified according to their surface appearance.
notes: root_depth halfway between bare/water and herbaceous

long_desc: All open land appearances without vegetation (mountaintop rock outcrops, volcanic craters, sandbar, beach sand), fire-scarred open land, and open land overgrown with reeds/grass. The appearance of open land for mining is classified as mining, while open land clearing is included in the class of agriculture, plantations or plantation forests.
notes: root_depth halfway between bare/water and herbaceous

long_desc: All wetland farming activities are characterized by a pattern of ripping.
shorthand: Halfway between Annual Crop and Swamp

long_desc: All plantation forest areas, both those that have been planted and those that have not (still in the form of vacant land). Location identification can be obtained with the Plantation Distribution Map. People's plantations, which are usually small in size, will be difficult to identify from images or distribution maps, so other information is needed, including field data.
notes: root depth halfway between open forest and herbaceous; Kc halfway between forest and herbaceous

long_desc: Inland or salting fishery activities that appear with a pattern of tanning around the coast.
Mangroves, nipahs, and nibung forests around the coast that have not yet revealed traces of logging. In some locations, mangrove forests are more inland
All forest appearances in swampy areas, including brackish swamps and peat bogs that have not yet revealed traces of logging

Non-natural forest appearance is a meadow, sometimes with few shrubs or trees. This appearance is a natural appearance in parts of Southeast Sulawesi, East Nusa Tenggara and the southern part of Papua.

The entire appearance of lowland forests, hills, and mountains that have revealed traces of logging (the appearance of grooves and patches of cut marks). Former severe logging is not forest plantation area, plantation or farm included open land

Mangroves, nipahs, and nibung forests around the coast that have shown traces of development with patterns of grooves, patches, and puddles. Especially for former logging that has changed its function to ponds / rice fields are classified into ponds / rice fields

All forest appearances in swampy areas, including brackish swamps and peat bogs, have revealed traces of logging. Severe logging marks if they do not show signs of inundation (water coverage) are classified as open ground while if they show traces of inundation or inundation, they are classified as water bodies (swamps)
Residential areas, whether urban, rural, industrial etc. Which shows the flow pattern of the meeting.
notes: assuming paved so doesn't generate any sediment (hence p = 0), but doesn't hang onto anything either (hence c = 1)

long_desc: Regrown areas of former dryland forests or areas with sparse (natural) tree coverage or areas with a predominance of low vegetation (natural). This area usually does not show any more logging traces / spots
The appearance of swampland that is no longer forested
notes: since mangrove Kc is 10% higher than forest kc, making marshland Kc 10% higher than herbaceous kc

long_desc: The entire area, whether cultivated or not, includes agricultural areas, cultivation and settlements in it.
All water catchments, including seas, rivers, lakes, reservoirs, coral reefs, seagrass beds etc. The appearance of ponds, rice fields and swamps is classified separately.
